name: Laughter Is the Best Medicine: Italian Cinematic Comedies and Comedians, Then a
description: (Offered in English) This course presents students with an overview of Commedia all'italiana (Comedy, Italian Style), an integral part of the fabric of Italian cinema, from its origins to its manifestations today. Students will learn about the importance and influence of the genre, which is deeply rooted in the history, politics, society, and culture of the Italian peninsula. Films and analyses will also centre on the Italian star system (such as Totò, Troisi, Benigni, and Zalone) and their works. [24L, 24T]
prerequisites: ITA200Y5/201Y5 or permission of the department. Prerequisite only applicable to students enrolled in an Italian Minor, Major or Specialist program.
